TopicTitle: GR Rocketry coming soon (tm) to a bar and grill near you! In Request of Plugin-coder

Articles.Content:
So me and my friend are starting a new parts pack called-and this is it's running name-GR Rocketry. or GR Aerospace, as it will have many more spaceplane parts than rocket parts. Any help you can give us is greatly appreciated. We will accept part requests for rocket parts and plane parts. (I prefer the rocketry more than the aerospace). We may end up re-doing the stock models used in Taviero's Pizza and Aerospace, and make them customized, that's an Idea we have. Also, no real-world requests, just like things that KSPX would add. Another idea, for instance, is a LiquidFuel and IntakeAir powered wheel, or an updated model to that box with wires on it that Radial Avionics Package and ORDA uses. But again, we accept requests, so make them! We are going to be up and running by August.

Gregory Brannon: Texture Artist and Conceptual Artist

Roberto LaCruz: Modeler, minor Concept Artist, cfg coder.

Such a shame I forgot to make my reserved posts untill after people already posted. ah well. Also, Why did "Devo" make a reserved post? That's odd.

Edited June 2, 2013 by GregroxMun

Well, changing your name might help. There's a mod called KW rocketry already.

Are you open to part suggestions?

The point is to sound like KW rocketry. Kickasskyle/Winston Rocketry or Gregory/Roberto Rocketry. How about just sticking with GR Aerospace? or perhaps GR8 Aerospace. It is Great, and it follows the formula of C7 and B9 Aerospace names. I am open to part suggestions, and for now name suggestions.

Can you make pulse jets? They seem like good engines for light spaceplanes.

Maybe one like this as a stack version

and a V-1 style valved one as a radial mount one.

Also, are you looking for another.cfg coder?

Edited May 15, 2013 by bs1110101
I'll ask Roberto if it's okay. Any moe information as to how it works?
Valveless ones are basiclly the same thing, but replacing the valve with an even funnier shaped tube.
Thx, I put you on the team list. I've already drawn up basic concept sketches of a .5m fuel tank and a .5m Pulsejet.

How about a spinning hub? Basically 2 stationary 2m docking ports and a small ring with 4 1m docking ports that rotates when activated. Uses electricity when turning and can be used as a hub for all your anti-gravity needs.

If you like I could post a diagram.

Edited May 17, 2013 by Psyckosama
I'm quite sure that would need a plugin, and the same thing already can be done with damned robotics.
Damned robots requires that you hold the key for it to function. This would just be an animation with a toggle switch. You turn it on, it starts to spin. You turn if off, it stops spinning.

Well, that would be useful, though still hard to code. and it can be made with the damned robotics parts in modular multiwheels and with rockets to spin it up, like this

Also, you can strut the ship together and the spinning bit will pass through the struts.

How about a RD-0120 rocket engine?

http://www.capcomespace.net/dossiers/espace_sovietique/buran_energia/energia%20moteur%20RD0120.jpg

EDIT:updated an old one, hasnt got a collider...but not that I care LOL

Edited June 1, 2013 by dimovski

Roberto does not currently have any plugin knowledge. Also, we are not doing replicas of real things, especially not things that can be replaced easily by stock engines. For instance, A generic pulse Jet is okay, but not a specific (And also complicated to model and texture) RD-0120 Rocket Engine. Sorry Dimovski.

Edited June 2, 2013 by GregroxMun
